moves.2... g6 3. Nc3 Bg7 4. Bf4: Rossolimo sticks to the accepted line.
moves.4... d6 5. Nf3 O-O 6. e3: White emerges with a temporary advantage in space.
moves.14... Nxh5 15. O-O-O f5 16. Rxh5: Sacrificing the Exchange to open up Koltanowski's defenses.
moves.16... gxh5 17. Rh1 h4 18. Rxh4: Continuing to pressure the weakened K-side.
moves.18... f4 19. Bxf4 Rxf4 20. Qxf4: Koltanowski has been forced to give back the Exchange, leaving Rossolimo a Pawn up.
moves.20... Qf8 21. Qxf8 Bxf8 22. f4: The fewer pieces remaining on the board, the bigger Rossolimo's Pawn advantage seems.
moves.22... Bg7 23. Bd3 Kg8 24. Ne2: Centralizing the Knight and strengthening his Pawns.
moves.24... Bd7 25. b3 Kf7 26. Ng3: Moving to the K-side, where the action is.
moves.26... Rh8 27. Kd2 Bd4 28. Rh2: To defend the pawn on KB2.
moves.28... Kf8 29. Ke1 Bc3+ 30. Kf1: With the K in place, the R is freed of guard duty.
moves.30... Bd2 31. Rh4 Bc3 32. Be2: Preparing to move out from behind the Pawn chin.
moves.32... Bf6 33. Rh1 Kf7 34. Bh5+: Freeing the B with a check.
moves.36... Kf8 37. Ne4 Bd4 38. Bg4: Looking to trade off another piece.
moves.38... Bxg4 39. Rxg4 Rg8 40. Rh4: With his Pawns split and his Rook tied down to defense, Koltanowski resigns.

players: Nicolas Rossolimo (Paris) vs. George Koltanowski (San Francisco)
